tool.name: eXpressConvertAndMergeDataForDEG
tool.description: column trimming, merge, and value convert to integer

param.name: input1
param.label: Select a suitable input file from your history

param.name: job_name
param.label: Supply a name for the outputs to remind you what they contain

configfiles.configfile:
cat("eXpress_ConvertAndMergeDataForDEG Started............\n") cat("\n")
library("dplyr") library("plyr") library("tidyr") library("stringr")
ourargs = commandArgs(TRUE) inf = ourargs[1] outf = ourargs[2] cat("input file name:");inf cat("output file name:");outf cat("\n")
path_list <- read.table(inf, header=T, row.names=1, sep="\t") head(path_list)
outp <- ldply( as.character(path_list[["file_name"]]), function(x){ data.frame(filename=basename(x), read.table(x, header = TRUE, row.names=1, sep="\t")) %>% select(filename, target_id, eff_counts) %>% mutate(eff_counts = as.integer(eff_counts))} ) %>% spread(filename, eff_counts)
cat("converted and trimmed data:\n") head(outp);nrow(outp) cat("\n")
write.table(outp, outf, quote=F, sep="\t", row.names=F, append=F) cat("....All Done. End of Script\n")

tool.help:
